data.value: Apply this rotation to a set of vectors.
If the original frame rotates to the final frame by this rotation, then its application to a vector can be seen in two ways:

_lines._line: - As a projection of vector components expressed in the final frame

data.value: - As a projection of vector components expressed in the final frame
to the original frame.

_lines._line: - As the physical rotation of a vector being glued to the original
frame as it rotates. In this case the vector components are
expressed in the original frame before and after the rotation.

data.value: - As the physical rotation of a vector being glued to the original
frame as it rotates. In this case the vector components are expressed in the original frame before and after the rotation.
In terms of rotation matricies, this application is the same as

represents a vector in 3D space. A single vector can either be specified with shape
or
. The number of rotations and number of vectors given must follow standard numpy broadcasting rules: either one of them equals unity or they both equal each other.
If True then the inverse of the rotation(s) is applied to the input vectors. Default is False.
